level5: Note that IP networking is, itself, comprised of a stack or semantic network of related protocols, from ARP (Ethernet MAC addressing) on to IP addressing, DNS name query services (recently augmented with Bonjour and Zeroconf service protocols) and the application layer protocols such as HTTP, IIOP, SSH, Mosh, DNS queries, etc
Must be suitable to connectionless (e.g DNS requests over UDP) and connection-oriented protocols (e.g HTTP, IIOP)
